, advisors , or investors . the ethiopian parliament approved last week a budget of birr 802bn for the 2023- 24 fiscal year , an increase of just 2 percent from the previous year . the very restrained spending growth presented in the new budget is positive for reducing the deficit and for helping lower inflation , but unfavorable spending patterns are becoming entrenched with rising allocations for debt service now a quarter of total government spending and a third of revenue and falling allocations for capital expenditure . 1. new budget the federal government budget approved by parliament on july 6 , 2023 amounted to birr 802 billion , equivalent to 15bn in usd terms and 7.1 percent of this years anticipated gdp . around 65 of the governments overall spending is to be funded by domestic revenue and grants , while the remainder will be covered by domestic borrowing 30 and external lenders 5 . 2. revenue an estimated birr 480bn is expected to be collected during the fiscal year . the highest share of revenue , birr 188bn or 39 of the total , is expected to come from trade taxes . direct taxes birr 141bn , including corporate and income taxes are expected to account for 30 of revenue , while the remaining sources include indirect taxes such as vat birr 112bn and non-tax revenue birr 39bn . 3. expenditure expenditure is set to rise by only birr 15bn vs the previous year . this reflects a level decline in capital expenditure down by birr 15bn or 7 percent offset by a birr 25bn increase in current expenditure and a birr 5bn increase in subsidies to regions . continuing recent trends , capital expenditure is now just 35 of total expenditure despite having once taken up as much as two-thirds of total spending . 4. spending allocation debt service is again the largest expenditure item in ethiopia 's budget , accounting for 28 of total spending and now increasingly devoted to covering domesticrather than externaldebt service payments . other large expenditure items are roads birr 68bn , 12 of the total , education birr 59bn,10 , defence birr 50bn , 9 , and health birr 23bn , 4 . 5. external financing of the total birr 281bn required to finance the deficit , only birr39bn 0.7 billion is expected from foreign borrowing mainly from the word bank ida and china exim bank per breakdowns shown in the budget document . 6. domestic financing as was the case last fiscal year , most of the burden of financing the budget deficit will fall on domestic lenders , and will be met by a mix of treasury bills bought mainly by the state bank and pension funds , treasury bonds purchased by private banks in amounts equal to 20 of their gross lending and direct advances borrowing from the
